channel.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
channel.description:
Hey. I've been working with 3ds max for a while, but never really posted any of my work, so here's some.
I'm posting this for criticism, i need to know what to improve on.
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/GlassFront-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/GlassPerspective-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/GlassTop-1.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/DeskandGlass-1.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/DeskandGlassFeetView.jpg[/img]
Thanks, give me your opinions.
I think the glass is perfect. But that's my opinion, quite proud of what i've done though. :)
P.s. Frell or any other mod just drop me a message if this topic doesn't belong here. Technically they are usable within the 317 client. ^.^

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:16, topic:280897”]That glass should be one of the wonders of the world.
Amazing, can i have it for my server? XD[/quote]


It wouldn’t look half as good, if i was doing it for a server i may aswell have made it in metasequoia and changed the alpha setting down.
Thanks for comments, keep em coming.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:13, topic:280897”][quote author=Frell link=topic=370969.msg2803025#msg2803025 date=1243550859]
Tile the carpet more.

The glass is good except for the part where the stem meets the stand.
[/quote]

Same thing as frell. Nice silent.[/quote]

I fixed both of them.
The glass is perfect, and i have now changed the UVW values on the carpet to make it look more realistic.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:


heres a wood texture i have and use, its not perfect as you can tell. Its a little shiny and about a third of third of the way up the picture you can see the line that signifies the restart of the texture but its a work in progress. One of the things with a wood texture is to just keep working at it to get it just right

All feedback has been taken in, and i have now changed a few aspects, give me feedback on the wood floor, i’m not good with UVing it to be realistic.

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

The glass is nice. I love messing with transparency:p the flooring is terrible tbh. Just find a hardwood floor texture.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:280897”][quote author=Frell link=topic=370969.msg2803025#msg2803025 date=1243550859]
Tile the carpet more.

The glass is good except for the part where the stem meets the stand.
[/quote]

now crank out some nice renders.

Ok, will do later.

And yes, i now noticed that it’s a little bumpy, i have now editted the mesh a little to make it a bit smoother, that is, if you mean’t the non straightness of the stem?
Or is it the actual connection between the stem and the stand?

Thanks for feedback all. :)[/quote]

Oh nevermind im sorry, it looked weird because of the reflection through the glass. It was fine as it was. Nice work

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:3, topic:280897”]Tile the carpet more.

The glass is good except for the part where the stem meets the stand.[/quote]

Ok, will do later.

And yes, i now noticed that it’s a little bumpy, i have now editted the mesh a little to make it a bit smoother, that is, if you mean’t the non straightness of the stem?
Or is it the actual connection between the stem and the stand?

Thanks for feedback all.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] 'Perfect'(?) Glass, and Desk
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Id use C4D as its not as complex and produces same results for you guys.

But you cant save with c4d after your 43 day trial is up. Its the same way for 3ds max.

I have a cracked version of c4d if anyone wants it after the 43 day trial(to make sure you like it). But warez talk isn’t allowed so pm me for more info.

Read full topic
